mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mrs. Washington's Bed Chamber, Mount Vernon.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 309 9th St., Washington, D. C. Only authorized Publisher of Mt. Vernon Views.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of Mansion's south lumber room, once believed to have been occupied by Mrs. Washington upon George Washington's death and formally titled 'Mrs. Washington's Bed Room or Chamber.' Later determined that Mrs. Washington resided in a different chamber on the third floor of the Mansion. Label on the reverse reads: Martha Washington's Bed Chamber, the same when she occupied it and where she died in 1802, Mt. Vernon.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (VA : Estate)
George Washington's Mount Vernon
South lumber room
